TextView.android:text: Circular Permutation
In this lesson, we will learn how to find the number of permutations of n distinct objects arranged in a circle.
Introduction to lesson

Suppose there are four chairs around a table to be occupied by four persons A, B, C and D, in how many ways can they arrange themselves? These four persons A, B, C and D, can arrange themselves in 4! ways if they are to be arranged in a row. There is a start and there is an end.
How many persons will occupy a seat in a row?
1st seat
4 persons
The 1st seat can be occupied by any of the four persons, A, B, C, or D. Let us say B occupies the 1st seat.
2nd seat
3 persons
Now, the 2nd seat can be occupied by any of the three remaining persons, A, C, or D. Let us say C occupies the 2nd seat.
3rd seat
2 persons
The 3rd seat next to C can be occupied by any of the remaining two remaining persons A, or D, say D.
4th seat
1 person
The fourth seat is to be occupied by the remaining person A.

Thus, by FCP the number of ways in which the four persons can arrange themselves in a row is 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 4! = 24 ways.\n\nIn a circular permutation, there is nothing like a start or an end. The four persons can be arranged in different ways.
How many persons will occupy a seat in a round table?
1st seat
1 person
A particular chair is to be designated as the first seat which serves as the starting point, and to be occupied by the designated first person, say B.
2nd seat
3 persons

Since the designated first seat is already occupied by the designated first person (B), then the next chair, either clockwise or counterclockwise, can now be occupied by any of the three remaining persons A, C, or D. Let us say D occupies the second seat.
3rd seat
2 persons
The third seat next to B can be occupied by any of the remaining three persons A, or C, say C.
4th seat
1 person
The fourth seat is to be occupied by the remaining person A.
